summary: Mahela Jayawardene, is a Sri Lankan cricket coach and former international cricketer

value.label: Mahela Jayawardene made his first class debut while playing for the Sinhalese Sports Club
Mahela Jayawardene made his international debut against India at Colombo in 1997

The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Image of India national cricket team

value.label: Jayawardene was a key member of the 1999 world cup team
Jayawardene played for the Kings XI Punjab from 2008 to 2010
The Kings XI Punjab (KXIP) are a franchise cricket team based in Mohali (Chandigarh CR), Punjab, that plays in the Indian Premier League.
Jayawardene along with Kumar Sangakkara created a world record for the highest run (624) partnership

image.altText: Jayawardene along with Kumar Sangakkara created a world record for the highest run (624) partnership

value.label: Jayawardene held the record for the second highest number of catches in Tests with 205 catches

image.altText: Jayawardene held the record for the second highest number of catches in Tests with 205 catches

value.label: In 2006, Jayawardene set the record for the highest individual score (374) in Tests by a right-handed batsman

image.altText: In 2006, Jayawardene set the record for the highest individual score (374) in Tests by a right-handed batsman

value.label: Jayawardene was the only fielder to take 400 catches in international cricket.

image.altText: Jayawardene was the only fielder to take 400 catches in international cricket.

value.label: Jayawardene held the record for the most career runs in ODI history when batting at number 4 position (6,946)

image.altText: Jayawardene held the record for the most career runs in ODI history when batting at number 4 position (6,946)

value.label: The Sri Lanka national cricket team, nicknamed The Lions, represents Sri Lanka in international cricket. It is a full member of the International Cricket Council (ICC) with Test, One-Day International (ODI) and T20 International (T20I) status.

image.altText: Picture of Sri Lanka national cricket team

value.label: The Delhi Capitals are a franchise cricket team that represents the city of Delhi in the Indian Premier League (IPL).
Singhalese Sports Club (SSC) is a first-class cricket club in Sri Lanka
